Class Mocha::Expectation
In: lib/mocha/expectation.rb
Parent: Object

Methods on expectations returned from Mocha::MockMethods#expects and Mocha::MockMethods#stubs

Methods

at_least   at_least_once   at_most   at_most_once   never   raises   returns   times   with   yields  

Public Instance methods

at_least(minimum_number_of_times) → expectation

Modifies expectation so that the expected method must be called at least a minimum_number_of_times. 

  object = mock()
  object.expects(:expected_method).at_least(2)
  3.times { object.expected_method } # => verify succeeds

  object = mock()
  object.expects(:expected_method).at_least(2)
  object.expected_method # => verify fails

[Source]

    # File lib/mocha/expectation.rb, line 94
94:     def at_least(minimum_number_of_times)
95:       times(Range.at_least(minimum_number_of_times))
96:       self
97:     end
at_least_once() → expectation

Modifies expectation so that the expected method must be called at least once. 

  object = mock()
  object.expects(:expected_method).at_least_once
  object.expected_method # => verify succeeds

  object = mock()
  object.expects(:expected_method).at_least_once
  # => verify fails

[Source]

     # File lib/mocha/expectation.rb, line 109
109:     def at_least_once()
110:       at_least(1)
111:       self
112:     end
at_most(maximum_number_of_times) → expectation

Modifies expectation so that the expected method must be called at most a maximum_number_of_times. 

  object = mock()
  object.expects(:expected_method).at_most(2)
  2.times { object.expected_method } # => verify succeeds

  object = mock()
  object.expects(:expected_method).at_most(2)
  3.times { object.expected_method } # => verify fails

[Source]

125:       times(Range.at_most(maximum_number_of_times))
126:       self
127:     end
at_most_once() → expectation

Modifies expectation so that the expected method must be called at most once. 

  object = mock()
  object.expects(:expected_method).at_most_once
  object.expected_method # => verify succeeds

  object = mock()
  object.expects(:expected_method).at_most_once
  2.times { object.expected_method } # => verify fails

[Source]

     # File lib/mocha/expectation.rb, line 139
139:     def at_most_once()
140:       at_most(1)
141:       self
142:     end
never → expectation

Modifies expectation so that the expected method must never be called. 

  object = mock()
  object.expects(:expected_method).never
  object.expected_method # => verify fails

  object = mock()
  object.expects(:expected_method).never
  object.expected_method # => verify succeeds

[Source]

    # File lib/mocha/expectation.rb, line 79
79:     def never
80:       times(0)
81:       self
82:     end
raises(exception = RuntimeError, message = nil) → expectation

Modifies expectation so that when the expected method is called, it raises the specified exception with the specified message. 

  object = mock()
  object.expects(:expected_method).raises(Exception, 'message')
  object.expected_method # => raises exception of class Exception and with message 'message'

[Source]

     # File lib/mocha/expectation.rb, line 212
212:     def raises(exception = RuntimeError, message = nil)
213:       @return_value = message ? lambda { raise exception, message } : lambda { raise exception }
214:       self
215:     end
returns(value) → expectation
:call-seq: returns(*values) → expectation

Modifies expectation so that when the expected method is called, it returns the specified value. 

  object = mock()
  object.stubs(:stubbed_method).returns('result')
  object.stubbed_method # => 'result'
  object.stubbed_method # => 'result'

If multiple values are given, these are returned in turn on consecutive calls to the method. 

  object = mock()
  object.stubs(:stubbed_method).returns(1, 2)
  object.stubbed_method # => 1
  object.stubbed_method # => 2

If value is a Proc, then expected method will return result of calling Proc. 

  object = mock()
  object.stubs(:stubbed_method).returns(lambda { rand(100) })
  object.stubbed_method # => 41
  object.stubbed_method # => 77

[Source]

     # File lib/mocha/expectation.rb, line 201
201:     def returns(*values)
202:       @return_value = (values.size > 1) ? lambda { values.shift } : @return_value = values.first
203:       self
204:     end
times(range) → expectation

Modifies expectation so that the number of calls to the expected method must be within a specific range.

range can be specified as an exact integer or as a range of integers 

  object = mock()
  object.expects(:expected_method).times(3)
  3.times { object.expected_method } # => verify succeeds

  object = mock()
  object.expects(:expected_method).times(3)
  2.times { object.expected_method } # => verify fails

  object = mock()
  object.expects(:expected_method).times(2..4)
  3.times { object.expected_method } # => verify succeeds

  object = mock()
  object.expects(:expected_method).times(2..4)
  object.expected_method # => verify fails

[Source]

    # File lib/mocha/expectation.rb, line 64
64:     def times(range)
65:       @count = range
66:       self
67:     end
with(*arguments, ¶meter_block) → expectation

Modifies expectation so that the expected method must be called with specified arguments. 

  object = mock()
  object.expects(:expected_method).with(:param1, :param2)
  object.expected_method(:param1, :param2) # => verify succeeds

  object = mock()
  object.expects(:expected_method).with(:param1, :param2)
  object.expected_method(:param3) # => verify fails

If a parameter_block is given, the block is called with the parameters passed to the expected method. The expectation is matched if the block evaluates to true. 

  object = mock()
  object.expects(:expected_method).with() { |value| value % 4 == 0 }
  object.expected_method(16) # => verify succeeds

  object = mock()
  object.expects(:expected_method).with() { |value| value % 4 == 0 }
  object.expected_method(17) # => verify fails

[Source]

     # File lib/mocha/expectation.rb, line 163
163:     def with(*arguments, &parameter_block)
164:       @parameters, @parameter_block = arguments, parameter_block
165:       class << @parameters; def to_s; join(', '); end; end
166:       self
167:     end
yields(*parameters) → expectation

Modifies expectation so that when the expected method is called, it yields with the specified parameters. 

  object = mock()
  object.expects(:expected_method).yields('result')
  yielded_value = nil
  object.expected_method { |value| yielded_value = value }
  yielded_value # => 'result'

[Source]

     # File lib/mocha/expectation.rb, line 177
177:     def yields(*parameters)
178:       @yield = true
179:       @parameters_to_yield = parameters
180:       self
181:     end
